algorithm
Class NaryCounter

java.lang.Object
  algorithm.NaryCounter

public class NaryCounter
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides an n-ary counter.
For example if we have a 3ary-counter with length = 2, it will count 

 00
 01
 02
 10
 11
 12
 20
 21
 22
 producing overflow
 (restatring at zero)
 00
 01
 ...
 ...

Author:
chrissy

Field Summary
protected  int[] counterArray
          This array provides the entries of the complete Nary number
protected  int length
          the Nary counter counts decimal number of length length and each entry from 0.. n-1
protected  int n
          the Nary counter counts decimal number of length length and each entry from 0.. n-1
protected  boolean overflow
          A variable, to check weather the last adding has caused an overflow

public NaryCounter(int n,
                   int length)
Initializes the counter

Parameters:
n - count the entries from 0..n-1

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

addOne

public void addOne()
Adds 1 to the actual state of the counter.
If an overflow is produced inside you can check this with the method producedOverflow

producedOverflow

public boolean producedOverflow()
Returns:
a boolean which is true iff an overflow inside the addOne -method has appeared.
